name: Amiga 3D Construction Kit
description: Amiga 3D Construction Kit is a 3D modeling, animation and VR-like environment development environment for the Amiga personal computer

commands.description: Checks whether the selected object has been activated.  This happens when the cursor is over the selected object and the right mouse button is pressed.

Performs logical and on the two values specified.  The value P1 is ANDed with the value P2 and if P2 is a variable specifier the result is stored in the specified variable.  CCR flags are set accordingly.

Checks the COLLIDED flag in the status byte of the current object.  A TRUE result is returned if a collision has occurred with this object since the last check.  Otherwise, a FALSE result is returned.  The COLLIDED flag is cleared upon executing this command.
Halts all FREESCAPE functions for the specified time.  The specified time P1 is in 50ths of a second.  For example DELAY(50) would halt execution for 1 second.
Serves to reset the environment.  This can be executed on a particular condition being TRUE or FALSE.  For example, if a counter being used to store game time reaches zero, then the game finishes.
Gets x coordinate
Gets y coordinate
Gets z coordinate
Moves the player from one area to another.
Sets the invisible flag on object P1 in the specified area p2.
Sets the invisible flag on object P1 in the specified area p2.
Moves by the specified offset
Moves to the specified coordinates
Logical OR

Checks the SHOT flag in the status byte of the current object.  If the object has been shot since the last time checked then the command returns a TRUE result otherwise a FALSE result is returned.  Execution of this command also clears the SHOT flag on the current object.
Plays sound for the specified sound
Starts an animation control
Stops an animation control
Performs a subtraction on the two supplied values.  The value P1 is subtracted from the value P2.
Plays the specified sound in sync with the next complete frame update

Checks the TIMER flag. The command returns TRUE if a timelapse of the amount specified in the defaults setup section has passed.  Otherwise, FALSE is returned.  This command is only really useful in LOCAL and GLOBAL conditions as these are the only conditions which are executed each frame.  Any TIME commands on objects will only be checked when some form of interaction takes place with the object.
Compares the values of P1 and P2.  TRUE is returned if P1 = P2.  Otherwise, FALSE is returned.
Compares the values of P1 and P2.  TRUE is returned if P1 > P2.  Otherwise, FALSE is returned.
